Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A couple of weeks ago, a staff member tickled a youth's privates.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was emailed on January 30, 2023. Complainant had no
further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 25,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Throughout the interview with Youth A, he changed the
sequence of events, locations, and people involved several times.
Youth A was consistent that Staff 2 “tickles” him on occasion and he
2

does not like that. Youth A originally stated that Staff 2 tickled his
stomach area, he then stated he tickled his sides from armpits to
knees, he later stated Staff 2 tickled him from armpits into a “V” shape
ending on his penis. Youth A first stated he did not think Staff 2
intentionally touched his penis, however later stated he does believe
Staff 2 was tickling his penis on purpose. Youth A said this occurred in
early December or late November, he was not able to remember the
date but stated there was no snow. Youth A said Staff 2 tickles him
“often” but stated this was the only time he touched his privates. Youth
A said he believed this occurred on a weekend after breakfast but
before lunch. Youth A originally said he believed the other staff and
youth were outside, later stating they were all in the basement. Youth A
originally said he was not able to remember where in the Gerber house
the tickling occurred however later stated it was in his bedroom. Youth
A changed between it occurring with him standing by a window to
laying on a mattress. Youth A changed the sequence of how the tickling
occurred several times ending with him stating Staff 2 was giving him
his medications, he flicked them out of Staff 2’s hand, poured water on
the floor, and ran into this room with Staff 2 following him and then
tickling him. Youth A was not able to recall what other staff were
working the day this took place. Youth A said “a few days ago” he
disclosed this to Staff 1. Youth A said he did not disclose it any sooner
as the other youth were “always around him”. Youth A confirmed he
has had several individual sessions with Therapist since the tickling
occurred and denied ever telling Therapist about the incident. Youth A
said he has never seen Staff 2 tickle any other youth. Youth A said he
does not like Staff 2 because Staff 2 pushed him down when he was
trying to throw rocks at a car. Youth A stated he “hates Eagle Village”
and believes Staff 2 should be “fired”, and Eagle Village should be “shut
down”.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on February 1,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said Gerber
house has been “chaotic” lately due to other youth’s behaviors. Youth B
said Staff 2 is a “regular” staff in the house but “was out” for a week or
so to “get a break”. Youth B said he has no concerns with any staff’s
interactions with the youth in the house.
Director of Quality was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
January 25, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Director of Quality said she received an email from the
residential director that Youth A disclosed to Staff 1 that a staff had
touched him inappropriately. Director of Quality said she met with Youth
A to obtain additional details and he disclosed that Staff 2 tickled his
belly, took it too far and tickled his privates and then stopped. Director
of Quality said Youth A was not able to tell her where or when it
4

occurred, or if any other youth or staff witnessed it. Director of Quality
said Youth A has been having a difficult time in the program lately and
is on a safety plan due to running out of the house and swallowing
objects. Director of Quality said Youth A has been making statements
about “getting this place shut down” referring to Eagle Village. Director
of Quality said tickling a youth would be considered “horseplay” and is
against the Eagle Village policy and procedures.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 25,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement.
Staff 1 said he has been working at Eagle Village since November 2022
and is assigned to second shift at Gerber house. Staff 1 said he works
about half his shifts with Staff 2. Staff 1 said he feels Staff 2 works will
with the youth in the house. Staff 1 said he cannot recall a specific time
when Staff 2 following Youth A to his room after Youth A refusing
medications. Staff 1 said Youth A does refuse his medications at times
with the most recent being just a few days ago. Staff 1 said Youth A
has been on a safety plan due to swallowing objects so staff sit at his
door to watch him more closely. Staff 1 said Staff 2 has sat at Youth A's
door to perform checks. Staff 1 said a couple days ago he was sitting at
Youth A’s door watching him when Youth A disclosed Staff 2 had
“tickled his privates”. Staff 1 said Youth A originally told him it was
before he was hired but then said it was when he was working at
Gerber house. Staff 1 said he then told his supervisor what Youth A
had said. Staff 1 said he has never seen Staff 2 alone with Youth A in
his room. Staff 1 said they are trained to always have a second staff
with them if they are going into a youth’s room. Staff 1 said he has
never seen Staff 2 tickle any youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 25,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement.
Staff 2 said he has been employed with Eagle Village for three years
and has been working at Gerber house since its reopening in the fall of
2022. Staff 2 said Youth A has been “doing whatever he wants”
recently and will frequently make comments about “not wanting to be
here”. Staff 2 said Youth A recently swallowed a battery and is now on
a safety plan which requires more frequent checks which he does not
like. Staff 2 said he feels he has a “good relationship” with Youth A as
he had worked with him in Hainely house prior to working with him at
Gerber. Staff 2 admitted to tickling Youth A as a way to redirect his
behaviors and distract him from whatever he is upset about. Staff 2 said
he has only tickled Youth A on his stomach. Staff 2 said other staff and
youth are around whenever he has tickled Youth A. Staff 2 said he has
never gone lower than his stomach and denied ever touching Youth A's
penis. Staff 2 said he has only ever tickled Youth A over his clothing
and Youth A has never told him that is makes him feel uncomfortable.
4

Staff 2 said he does not tickle any other youth. Staff 2 said due to the
recent safety plan with Youth A, he has had to go into his room alone to
stop him from swallowing a crayon. Staff 2 said this occurred recently,
stating he was doing checks on Youth A when Youth A was in his room.
Staff 2 said Youth A began to break and attempt to swallow a crayon.
Staff 2 said he called for staff assistance however made the decision to
go into the room and get the crayons before the other staff arrived. Staff
2 said he did not tickle Youth A during that incident. Staff 2 said he was
trained on the policies and procedures of Eagle Village and did not
recall that tickling was against the rules however was able to agree that
it was not a good tool to use with youth after further discussion with
Director of Quality.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January
25, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Therapist said she
works weekly with Youth A in therapy on his treatment and for the last
several weeks all Youth A wants to talk about is getting Eagle Village
shut down so that he can leave. Therapist said Youth A has struggled
whenever he is held accountable to follow the program expectations.
Therapist said Youth A has never disclosed any staff tickling him or
touching him inappropriately. Therapist said she has never seen Staff 2
tickling any youth and would address that as inappropriate with Staff 2 if
she witnessed it.
Documents Reviewed
• Staff 2’s personnel file was reviewed. Staff 2 has been employed
since February 28, 2020. Staff 2 completed all policy and
procedure training on January 27, 2021. Staff 2 had no
disciplinary record in his file.
• Eagle Village Policy and Procedure “Staff/Resident Horseplay”.
This procedure outlines that staff are not to engage in any
horseplay with residents stating, “Though horseplay is
considered normal behavior between children and adolescents
and can even be considered a healthy outlet of energy, because
of the abusive history and volatile nature of the behavior of so
many of our residents, it is strictly forbidden.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with Program Statement, Staff 2
admitted to tickling Youth A on occasion with is prohibited by the
facilities “Staff/Resident Horseplay” procedure.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that
the current license status be continued.
